definitions.definition: The separation , alignment or orientation of something into two opposed poles .
Either of the two extremes of such attributes.
The dipole -dipole intermolecular forces between the slightly positively-charged end of one molecule to the negative end of another or the same molecule .
The division of an embryo into an animal pole and a vegetal pole within a blastula .
Spatial differences in shape, structure, and function within a cell.
A measure of the electrical potential at the ends of a circuit .
The direction of a wave 's amplitude or its being in phase or antiphase .
The grammatical category of the affirmative and the negative .
A duality that is an involution , i.e. has order two.
An indicator of the positivity or negativity of a literal .
Any of the various ways in which power is distributed within the international system .
The concept of dualism between masculine and feminine .

main_definition: The separation , alignment or orientation of something into two opposed poles .
secondary_definitions: Either of the two extremes of such attributes.
( chemistry ) The dipole -dipole intermolecular forces between the slightly positively-charged end of one molecule to the negative end of another or the same molecule .
( embryology ) The division of an embryo into an animal pole and a vegetal pole within a blastula .
( microbiology ) Spatial differences in shape, structure, and function within a cell.
( electricity ) A measure of the electrical potential at the ends of a circuit .
( physics ) The direction of a wave 's amplitude or its being in phase or antiphase .
( grammar ) The grammatical category of the affirmative and the negative .
( projective geometry ) A duality that is an involution , i.e. has order two.
( mathematics ) An indicator of the positivity or negativity of a literal .
( politics ) Any of the various ways in which power is distributed within the international system .
( gender ) The concept of dualism between masculine and feminine .
